attributes.action: End Euthanasia on the basis of cost. Law on Do Not Resuscitate
attributes.additional_details:
Create law that medical professionals must resuscitate, give CPR and intubate (breathing tube) any and all patients irrespective of age, disability or illness. Patients will have the right and preservation to life in hospitals. Patients and patient's wife and adult children to have the right in law to demand life-preserving medication and CPR.

This law to supercede all other laws and guidelines.

Any patient demanding Do Not Resuscitate / Do not intubate to have such rights only by their prior written consent, counter-signed by a legal professional and the patient’s spouse / civil partner / children altogether. There must be this Living Will before admission to hospital. The patient must be deemed mentally competent. No-one else can consent to their DNR / Do not Intubate on their behalf. A Living Will cannot be gained by a patient once admitted to hospital by the enactment of this Act/Bill.
